revised_title: The Evolutionary Continuity and Chronology of Modern Humans in East Asia and Australasia
tldr: This article discusses the origins and evolution of modern humans in East Asia and Australasia, focusing on the debate surrounding the continuity of evolutionary traits between Pleistocene and recent human populations. The authors analyze key skeletal remains and discuss the challenges in dating and preserving hominid materials in both regions. They also examine the regional chronology of modern Homo sapiens and the significance of various skeletal collections in shaping the understanding of human evolution in these areas.
